medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Abdominal pain began approximately 1 week ago and has worsened over the past 24 hours, becoming much more constant and located on the right side. Pain worsens with movement. Patient experienced fever up to 100.2 at home and mild nausea, but no vomiting. Normal bowel movements did not provide relief of the pain. This is the first time the patient has experienced pain like this.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Stable angina, anxiety, depression, hypercholesterolemia, erectile dysfunction, low back pain, fungal umbilical infection; past surgical history includes tonsillectomy.
